conversations.content: Please note that this story contains spoilers for Tobias's adventurer story, as well as the ＂Blessed Bloodline＂ event.
I'iii...iyaAH... Aaagh...
GroooAAAR!
Dezes Region The remote northern village of Pasaritsa
I must thank you again. Your efforts have kept our village safe from fiends.
You truly are a messenger of the Goddess Ilia, Tobias.
It is a Paladyn's calling to protect the people's happiness. I only did my duty as a knight of the Church stationed here.
Oh ho ho! Ever the humble one. Well, we'll be singing the Goddess's praises for sending you to us till the end of our days.
Sir, I'm hardly—
What? The gem is glowing?!
(If the Goddess's protective charm is responding... Is Nino in danger again? No... This is different from the last time.)
W-we've got trouble, Mister Tobias! Fiends in the village, sir! A whole flood of 'em!
What?!
Aaaaaaah!
S-stay back... Please! Somebody help!
Are you all right?!
Tobias! Thank the Goddess you came!
I live to protect the happiness of Her beloved children. That alone is a Paladyn's duty!
Amazing... You felled it in the blink of an eye.
There's no time for standing slack-jawed. Get to safety, quickly!
R-right!
Is there anyone else still left behind?
Rgh! They just keep coming. Where are this many fiends even coming from?
The gem is responding again...
An Otherworld rift! Then is that what this light is about?
...iii...iyAAAaH!
(Fiends are pouring forth from the rift. I have to find some way to close it!)
This feeling I'm getting from the armor... It's worth a try.
Hraaaaah!
Rgh... Nearly there! Rrraaaaagh!
*heave* *pant* It's... It's over...
(Can't...move my...body... What's happened to me?)
...ia, I wanted...with you again...
(That voice... It's the same one I heard before when wearing the armor.)
I'm proud of you for choosing to leave this world to secure peace for those of us left behind.
For you, I gave up my name, my home... I gave up everything to watch over this world you protected to the last.
But even if I lose everything, as long as I can keep the ones I love safe...!
(The voice is coming from inside my own head. Just who is this woman?)
I want to protect you because I love you. You, and this world. You may not share my blood, but... I'm your mother.
What reason does a mother need? All my heart and all my might exist to protect the happiness of my beloved children...
(Those words! Then, was she...?!)
I pray that whoever holds this now will use it to safeguard the future.
(This light is the same as that given off by the gem. I know now who speaks!)
That was...a scene of the past, from when this armor was made. Its creator's thoughts flowed into my mind.
I pray that whoever holds this now will use it to safeguard the future.
The heartfelt plea of a woman who had given everything in service of her pure desire for all to live lives of contentment...
It's the same wish I've harbored for so long.
Love is aught given to others, Tobias. Think not of yourself, but dedicate all your heart and all your might to others' happiness.
My father's teachings... The Goddess's divine spirit resides here with me!
I swear, here and now! I will hold this lesson close and give all I have to shepherd Her children toward a world of peace!
That is my duty as Paladyn—as the one who inherited this holy relic. And I will see it done, even if I must forfeit my life!
Halidom Aeleen's Room
...There. You're all set, dear.
Sorry to trouble you for an examination.
Not at all. I'm a nurse! If anything, I should be the one to apologize...
Please, you've done more than enough. The medicine you've given me feels like it's helping considerably.
Just the same, don't push yourself. The medication is only a stopgap measure. It can stabilize your mana for now, but...
Until we can learn the root cause of your condition, I'm afraid there's no telling when you might lose consciousness again.
The root cause...
This ends here! HAAAH!
Nrgh, this sensation... I fear it's... But even so, I've a duty to see done.
Wait... Tobias?!
What happened to you? Don't tell me a fiend did this! Given your strength, I can't imagine...
Nino? Why are you here?
That's my line. Why are you out here in the middle of nowhere? Actually, forget that. You look like you're in pain. You all right?
Yes, I just...need a little while to rest. ...Ngh!
You always pull this tough-guy act when you're falling apart!
I've got a little hideout nearby. Let's get you there so you can rest up.
Nino's Hideaway
Well? Caught your breath?
Yes. I feel much better, thank you.
(This home looks exactly like the one from the memories the armor showed to me. Does that mean that woman used to...?)
Curious about this place, I take it?
It was a hideout my ancestor once used. It's made for a convenient hub between all my travels.
Or...was there something specific about it on your mind?
There was, actually.
...I see. So you came here to find the cause of your condition.
I didn't have any other leads to pursue. Plus, I was curious to see where this armor was made firsthand.
Huh. I didn't take you for such a free spirit.
I'm not simply sightseeing, you know.
I know. I was only teasing. But back to your condition...
Wait there a second. When I was cleaning this place up, I found a journal containing  an interesting tidbit. I think it's...here?
Aha. Found it. Anyway, I flipped through it earlier, and there was a mention of that armor among my ancestor's notes.
I was curious, but I felt a little bad reading someone else's diary, so I didn't dig too deep into it.
The passage was around... Here, yeah. ＂The tremendous protection imbued in the armor brings with it tremendous strain.＂
＂Wearing it disrupts one's mana, meaning that extended wear will cause even the ideal user to eventually—＂
Burn their own life force and die, I assume?
That's horrible! But...back when you saved me, there was no sign of that at all!
I suppose that means I'm close to that ＂ideal user.＂ At first, it must not have had a noticeable effect on my internal mana.
But if you keep wearing it...
Thank you, Nino. That clarifies the cause of my malady. It was just as I suspected.
At least now you know never to use it again. Even the best armor isn't much help if it kills you.
Actually...
Wait. Don't tell me you plan to keep wearing it? Tobias, you could DIE!
I understand that. But I want to protect the people's happiness however I can, even if it comes at the cost of my life.
Why push yourself to such extremes?
My father was a bishop of the Church. Stern, but kind. He always put the needs of the faithful above his own.
He was the sort of man who would share his last crumb of bread with his neighbor, even if he went starving.
He rarely smiled, but everyone who came to see him left with a smile. I loved him dearly, and respect him with all my heart.
I became a knight because I wanted to be like him. To serve others.
That's still no reason to sacrifice your own life in the process.
But that's the ideal I've chased all my life. And it's the will imbued into this armor.
You're telling me that armor has a will?
I've inherited the resolve She put into it— the will of the Goddess to see the people made happy, even at the cost of Her life.
For that, I will fight until my body breaks!
A laudable sentiment, yes, but—!
Please don't stop me, Nino. This is my duty to see done.
Tobias...
Dezes Region Northwest Lake Shore
HAAAAH!
Phew. That should be the last of the fiends in the area.
(A sudden surge in the fiend population... There must be another rift nearby. I have to find and seal it.)
...Krgh?!
Tobias! Are you all right?!
Nino... Why are you here in Dezes?
I came to check in on you. How could I not, after what you said when we parted?
I'm sorry to have worried you.
Forget that. You're pale. ...How bad is it?
If my suffering allows these people to live in safety and happiness, I will gladly endure.
How can you say that?! I'm guessing you haven't even given yourself the time to rest. You have to allow your body to heal!
I'm afraid I don't have the luxury. Fiend savagery has been on a sharp rise in Dezes lately.
It has to be cut off at the source before the damage spreads any further, and I'm the only one here able to do that.
But if you keep this madness up, you really will end up dead!
...I'm aware. And when that time comes—
Mister Tobias! Help!
Has something happened to your village?!
F-fiends, sir! They're coming in droves! And one of them is way stronger than the rest!
Nino, I'm leaving him with you!
Leaving him—hey! I'm telling you, your body can't...! Rrgh, that stubborn ox!
Dezes Region Pasaritsa Village
Thankfully, it seems the villagers have all evacuated. But a pack of fiends this large...
GrrRRROAR!
Is that the one the boy mentioned?! This evil mana... It's almost like...!
Iiii... iLi...iAaa...! CuRsE... CuRSe yOU, cuRsE YoU, CurSE yOU, cuRSe yoU, CUrse YoU! ElySiuM... ELYSIUUUM!
A remnant of the Other?! Has its powerful hatred for the Goddess and the Holywyrm taken hold of a fiend?
GrAAaaAH!
...iiiiLiaAAaa! EelYsiUuuM!
The wrathful evil residing in that fiend is spreading to the others!
I have to sever it at the root. Rrgh, out of my way! I have business with that one!
Grrngh?!
That was cutting it awfully close.
...I'm sorry. And thank you. Where is the boy?
Don't worry. He's with the other villagers in a safe place.
GrrrRrgH... GrRRAOOOAR!
That sinister mana... There's no question that one's the boss.
It seems able to create otherworld rifts and pull new minions into this world.
Then I guess we'll have to start with him.
Agreed. But...
GROAARAAARGH!
We can't leave the small fry unchecked while we take it down.
Then you keep an eye on them while I handle the big one.
Wait. It's too powerful to—
Nope. I'm not letting you push yourself too far when I'm right here. I want you alive, Tobias. So this is MY fight!
WAIT! Rgh, stubborn girl...
Hraaaah!
(There's no stopping her now. All I can do is hurry and clear out these underlings so I can join her!)
Nraaaaah!
Grgh?! This is insanely strong!
No—aaaaaugh!
NINO!
Out of my WAY!
Tobias, don't! You can't use that!
Rrraaaaagh!
SkrEeeAGh?!
Begone!
GnRGH... iiLiaAAaAH!
*heave* *gasp* Rngh!
TOBIAS! I told you not to... Why?! Stupid...STUPID!
I'm sorry. But I...told you, didn't I? That I'll gladly give my life to...protect Her beloved children...
Wait... Tobias, please! What are you going to do?! You can't! Please, stop! Any more, and you really will die!
All my heart and...all my might... This is my duty. This is the will of this armor!
Even if it means my death, I give it gladly!
Rgh... GrrraaaAAAH!
There. Now, I...can...
No, Tobias... TOBIAS! NOOOOOOOOO!
I can't see anything. Ah. So I've died...
I have no regrets. I swore to protect the people at the cost of my own life, and I have seen that oath through. My death is—
What is this light?!
Good. Now this armor should allow the wearer to withstand the otherworld.
I have to say, making something like this for myself really highlights what a genius she was.
She was so truly precious...
(So she too had someone important to her.)
(Is this...a different memory now?)
Just how much time has passed since you left this world?
My name, my home... I've given up so much to keep protecting this world you fought for.
And I would do it all again. But the one thing I was never able to truly let go of... was you.
I only made this so that I could search for you beyond the otherworld gate.
I want to see you again. I broke my wings, took on a new identity...but that single thought has never left me.
And yet I can't leave. Not after assuming my vigil.
In becoming mother to all, I have failed to mother the one who matters most: you.
(Her thoughts and emotions are flooding into me. Her grief wrenches my insides. But...there's something more?)
I've been thinking ever since. I believe that the choice you made was the right one. But it wasn't what I'd wanted.
At the time, you had no choice but to sacrifice yourself, but if some alternative had existed, I'd want you to take it.
So I've decided to pass on this armor I made to search for you. To protect the world—to protect my beloved children.
In the hopes that someone who feels as you did will tread the path you were denied!
Sacrificing yourself for the ones you love may be noble, but I still wish for you to choose a path where you live on.
(A path of life, instead of sacrifice...)
Love is aught given to others, Tobias. Think not of yourself, but dedicate all your heart and all your might to others' happiness.
In time, that love will find its way back to you. To love one's neighbor is to love oneself. So never forget this lesson.
The Goddess does not ask for you to make a sacrifice of yourself. For you are as much Her beloved child as any other.
(Father... You taught me this lesson from an early age, but only now do I truly understand its meaning.)
I will no longer be led by the hand like a child. My job now is to guide.
Yes, I suppose you're right.
I shall leave the perditionists to you, Tobias.
(Elisanne... Though our beliefs and methods differ, we swore to give our all to accomplish the same goal.)
I'm not an object in need of protection anymore. I'll overcome what troubles the future may bring myself.
I want to travel. To see the world with my own two eyes.
I see. In that case...
Let me return the gem that forms this armor to you. It was a charm handed down for your protection.
No. You keep it. I don't think I'm really built to wear armor. Plus...
I'm sure my ancestors would rather it be used in the fight for a happier world.
(I swore to Nino I would give my all to protect the people's happiness when I accepted that charm from her.)
(All along, I had a cause to fight for. A reason I can't afford to die.)
I want to protect you because I love you. You, and this world. So I want you to live.
May you give all your heart and all your might to protect all of my beloved children...including yourself.
(So this is the true desire she imbued this armor with. If I'm to live up to that wish, even a little longer, I—!)
You awake?
Where...?
Your place. The one in Dezes, anyway. And before you worry, the villagers are all safe. You were in worse shape than anyone.
You were out for almost three full days. A nurse came by to look in on you. She just left. Real cute. Blonde.
Aeleen... I'll have to thank her later.
So, uh... What is she to you, anyway?
I'm afraid I don't follow.
You know, like, are you two... Ugh, forget it! We need to talk about that armor. I doubt you need me to tell you this, but—
But don't use it?
You cut it AWFULLY close this time, Tobias. If it happens again, there's no guarantee you'll come back from it.
If you die because of something I gave you... Tobias, it'd be like I killed you myself. I don't want that.
Don't make me worry like this. Please.
I'm sorry, Nino. But there will surely be times when I have to don that armor and fight for the people, even if it kills me.
And we're back to square one.
Not so, because I promise you this: I'll never again speak of happily giving up my life when wearing the armor you gave me.
Tobias...
I misunderstood the desire that drove your ancestor to make that armor.
Sacrificing oneself for the well-being of others... Even now, I do believe that to be a noble wish, true to the Goddess's will.
But that kind of self-sacrifice was not what She desired for those who would inherit Her creation in future generations.
She sought a path where everyone could live. A solution that did not call for anyone to be sacrificed.
Because She believed in everyone's right to happiness...including our own.
...All right. I'm not sure what changed while you were sleeping, but I'll accept your answer, for now.
If it seemed like you were still gung-ho about risking your own neck, I was going to take that gem back from you.
But...I guess I can let you hold on to it for a while longer. You'll need it to keep us all safe, right? Yourself included?
Myself included. And thank you, Nino.
Oh no! Oh NO!
There's a HUGE fiend coming up the road! The villagers are being attacked!
I'll be there as quickly as I'm able.
Do you hear yourself?! You're still recovering, Tobias!
You JUST got through promising me you wouldn't go throwing your life away. Leave this one to me and get some rest.
I appreciate your concern, but I'm fine. All that sleep did me a world of good.
Tobias, I swear to the GODDESS—
Self-sacrifice is a one-time affair. Once you're gone, the happiness you preserved is defenseless.
That goes against the will of the one who made this armor, and against my own ideals and those of my companions.
So I'll choose not to cast my life away for the people's sake, but to live for them.
To go on living with them for years to come, so that my vigil can endure. ...Please, Nino. Let me go.
...You're impossible. You know that, right? But you're not going alone. I'll be there to make sure you don't do anything crazy.
Then let's be off!
To give all our hearts and all our might to keep ALL of us safe and happy, just as your ancestor wanted!
